data.title: Good Lunch Time Sandwich
data.text: Instead of Subway I decided to stop by and try a sandwich at this shop. I was really surprised how good it was. I had the corn beef Rueben with mustard. The sandwich was wam good freshly prepared while I waited. In addition I had a blueberry muffin which was equally tasty. I will return very soon.

data.title: Fantastic service & food!
data.text: Tom & Lisa make everyone feel welcome at Capitol Bistro. I ordered the quiche of the day & the food was a very generous portion, arrived hot, & was absolutely wonderful! My friend ordered the chicken ranch wrap & again the portion was very generous & excellent! A special litle area is also set up to purchase little keepsakes - they range from plaques to scarves to framed pictures that their Daughter Lauren took in Ireland - stop by for lunch or breakfast -  I will definitely be returning soon -you will love Capitol Bistro!

data.title: Overpriced.
data.text:
The price of a Sausage, Egg, and Cheese biscuit is $3.85... But, what if I don't want the Egg & Cheese? It's still $3.85. 

So, you mean to tell me I'll be paying $3.85 for just a sausage & biscuit? No thanks! I can get a Sausage & biscuit at McDonald's or Burger king for $1. 

I have also gotten the Chicken Breast Wrap for lunch and the chicken is COLD. Which is a huge turnoff. I'm just not a fan personally. But to each its own...

data.title: Limited Menu on a Sunday Night, Slooooow Service
data.text: We stayed at the Capitol Hotel on a cross country trip.  To our surprise, almost every restaurant in downtown Little Rock was closed on a Sunday night, so we went to the Capitol Bistro, which remained open.  The range of entrees on the menu was very limited, featuring mostly meat dishes.  The quality of our dishes was quite good, but the service was very slow and tentative.  The prices were fairly high as well.  It seems that the Sunday night experience is different from other nights (the posted menu for the Bistro does not include dinner, and the menu for the restaurant at the hotel is different from the one we had).  Definitely a city to avoid on Sunday night.

data.title: Wonderful People, Good Food
data.text: Good sandwiches and soups.  The quiche and salads are also very good. Tom and Lisa own and run the place and always make me feel welcome.

data.title: Food was good but I found a long hair in wrap.
data.text: Food was good until I found a long hair in the wrap, I understand it happens but I ended up throwing half of it out.

data.title: Excellent Wraps
data.text: I've been here for lunch many, many, many times and regardless of what I order, the food is always fabulous and I have never been disappointed.  Their wraps are especially good (and big).  I usually get the chicken Ceasar salad wrap.  And along with your entree, you get your choice of a side item and fruit.  The side items are always good and the fruit is always fresh.  Fabulous little bistro for lunch!

data.title: Great coffee spot
data.text: Walked from capital building to a nice, clean inviting cafe. Had a coffee and muffin mid-morning. Good coffee and fresh baked goods. They have breakfast sandwich too   No wifi but great prices and welcoming tables inside and out with capital building view
